Reviews.Content: Don't judge a book by its cover... As my taxi approached the hotel, a sense of mild dread came over me, spurred-on by the bleak external facades of a building whose design inspiration appeared to be melancholy.However.Once past the entrance, as if playing some kind of Germanic prank, the hotel reveals a very modern, minimalist interior with fast shiny lifts, funky mood lighting and a team of helpful, uber-efficient desk staff.The breakfast spread is business class and caters to most tastes and you can use a local gym (5 minute walk) free of charge. The rooms are also well insulated from any traffic noise outside.The town centre is approx. 3km away, but the hotel itself was perfect for a business stop-over.
Reviews.Author: Wotski

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Experience This was my first time to Europe and I was worried that I would not be satisfied with the entire hotel experience in general as I heard it is a much different experience than accomodations in the states. I did not find this to be the case at all. I was very impressed with my stay. I took the shuttle from FRA directly to the hotel. It arrives on the hour and on the half-hour. It arrives outside of the Terminal 1 Hall A arrival area. It took me a while to find the location but once I did the shuttle arrived right on schedule. The driver was nice but spoke little English. The shuttle is free but I tipped him $10 euro. Once arriving at the hotel, check in was quick and I was offered help with my bags up to my room. Once inside the room, I found it to be somewhat smaller than the average American hotel but certainly not cramped. The room, bedding and bathroom was very clean. The bed was as large as a King but had a King size box-springs and 2 twin mattresses on top of that. At first it was a bit awkward, however it was very comfortable. There were four pillows all very comfy as well. The overall room decor was pretty and modern. The bathroom had a shower only, glass enclosed with wonderful water pressure. Every travel sized personal item you could ever need was in a basket on the counter top. Soaps, shampoo, conditioner, body gel, mini-sponges, toothbrush, toothpaste, mouth-wash.....even lip balm and a sewing kit. There was a hair-dryer as well. Hung in the closet was a fresh robe and slippers. There was a well-stocked mini-bar that is computerized so be careful before you just pull something out as you will be automatically charged. No microwave but that wasn't a big deal to me because I didn't actually need one. The hotel bar was nice although it closes rather early at mid-night. In house meals were good too. I never ate in the acutal dining room but ordered room service twice which was prompt and tasty. The breakfast buffet was tasty and extensive with selection but pricey as well, $17 euro to be exact. There are two computers in the lobby with free internet access. I learned that the German keyboard is slightly different than the American one, so I googled German keyboard to get a quick lesson. There is also a large covered parking deck and that was nice as I had someone visiting me who lived in country, however parking is not free. It was $13 euro per day. I took the shuttle back to the airport upon departure and it leaves at 15 til and 15 past the hour. Again prompt and courteous. There was a small language barrier at the hotel but not so much that it can't be worked around. All of the staff I experienced spoke at least some English. Again, overall, very, very impressed. Would definitely stay again if I return to Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: layla_lou

Reviews.Content: Great lay-over hotel Stayed at NH Frankfurt Niederrad overnight. Our flight landed at 8:00 pm, and we easily located the shuttle pick-up location on arrivals level, right outside the baggage hall. After calling the hotel, the shuttle picked us up within 15 minutes. Upon arrival, we were quickly and efficiently checked in (the front desk lady was very quick, but a little cold). Our room was on the fifth floor, and very nice and modern. The bathroom only had a shower, but it was HUGE. We didn't eat at the hotel due to the cost, however, there are several supermarkets in the area. We went to the one next door to grab snacks for the night and to grab breakfast for the morning.We received a very friendly wake-up call, and were able to catch the complimentary shuttle (which runs every half hour). The ride to the airport was quick, although they drop you off at arrivals, rather than on the departures level.Overall, a very nice hotel for an overnight trip!
Reviews.Author: tippy012

Reviews.Content: 4 star Stayed one night before flying out of Frankfurt. Booked the hotel on Expedia for $70 a night including taxes. 4-star business class hotel with free internet in the lobby. Big room with fantastic bed. TV had movies in English along with CNN and BBC news. Nice bathroom. Easy, free shuttle to and from airport runs every 30 minutes. Dinner was very pricey so decided to eat at an Italian place about 200 yds away and had a fantastic meal. Breakfast in incredible, but be prepared to pay 18 Euro per person if not included in room price. No place better to stay before or after flights from Frankfurt. 1/3 the price of the airport Sheraton.
Reviews.Author: agedude

Reviews.Content: OK! I was put up by Lufthansa here on a 1 night stop when the plane was delayed (well, about 5 hours actually)Near to airport, bus provided.Room aws OK, quiet and comfy.Punctual reception, efficient breakfast.A good stopover choice.
Reviews.Author: expectant customer

Reviews.Content: Excellent stopover hotel Was looking for a decent hotel on stopover through Frankfurt and this fit perfectly. Free shuttle to airport by bus every half hour, and still easy to get into Frankfurt if desired. Good size rooms, well decorated, and clean. A very modern hotel. Dinner in restaurant was good and reasonably priced. Very good value at 69 Euro per night. Not much in the area but not relevant if you are looking for a comfortable sleep between flights.
Reviews.Author: vancanuck

Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, but a little out of the way In the past I have stayed at the NH Frankfurt City, which I like very much. But due to the above mentioned hotel being sold out I tried their branch in Niederrad. Very similar hotel in terms of style and comfort. Much like a Westin, in my opinion. My only complaint is that it is a 15 min walk to the Niederrad train station, and trains are not that frequent at certain times of day. And if you are carrying or wheeling luggage, this is a real annoyance. At night they can be 30 mins apart, which means the entire commute can be bothersome, especially if you are having business meetings and dinners near the center. I would stay there again if I had to, but would still prefer the NH Frankfurt City
Reviews.Author: gourmet2go

Reviews.Content: A pleasant surprise! I'd booked this hotel for a quick overnight and found it a very pleasant stay. Like the Novotel Bern Expo in which we'd stayed a few nights earlier, this hotel is very clean, modern and comfortable. Personnel is multilingual and extremely pleasant. Prices were friendly enough so that we were able to reserve two rooms for our family rather than sharing a triple as we had in Switzerland. Both rooms were spacious and comfortable. Worth noting is that there is a train track right behind the hotel, so it's advised that you leave the windows shut. We were on the railway side of the hotel and with the windows shut didn't notice a sound.This Novotel has a good assortment of dishes on the dinner menu which are both well executed and beautifully presented. We chose to dine on the windy outside patio which isn't far from the train tracks. Even outside, the trains are quiet enough not to interfere with normal dinner conversation. Dinner was tasty from start to finish.The breakfast buffet is well worth the supplemental cost -- there is something for everybody and plenty of it. Breads, meats, cheeses, muesli, yogurts, eggs, sausages, pastries, cereals, waffles, fruits and more are all set out in a huge buffet-- all of it very tasty. We arrived via rail and left via air, opting to handle both transfers by taxi. Both were about 10 minutes from the Novotel. There was a computer terminal and printer in the lobby which I was able to use to check in with the airline and print out our boarding passes. Based upon our flight departure time, the hotel arranged our taxi pickup perfectly the night before and we arrived at the airport in the morning with plenty of time to spare.A firm thumbs-up for this hotel!
Reviews.Author: Neanne

Reviews.Content: a lovely clean hotel A pleasant, clean, modern hotel. very helpful staff who speak excellant English and cannot do enough to help. Fluffy bathrobes and slippers not to mention the little things like a nail file, hairbrush, toothbrush and toothpaste the list goes on. A fantastic hotel that literally caters for your every need. Food in the restraunt also fab very tasty meals. Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: WestYorkshiregirl

Reviews.Content: Excellent service, very comfortable and functional Stayed here while attending the Ambiente fair. Found a reasonable rate directly from the NH hotel's website. Even though I knew I wouldn't be spending so much time at the hotel, I still prefered to pay a bit more for the high quality.The hotel was very safe for women travellers. There was a free shuttle from the airport and as I was pressed for time I paid the 10-15 EUR for taxis to the centre, although it would have been possible to take the train a few stops to the main station in Frankfurt.The room had very nice amenities, was very clean and the layout was extremely functional- very helpful for those who need to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night-no need to fumble looking for the lightswitch!I didn't try the buffet breakfast because I thought 17 EUR was a bit pricey for someone who doesn't eat much and was in a hurry. There is a mini-mall with a cafe around the corner and a LIDL supermarket across the street.The staff was very welcoming and helpful.
Reviews.Author: arttest

Reviews.Content: perfect for night before flight out We were not spending any time in Frankfurt, just needed a nice place to stay the night before our morning flight home from Frankfurt. This hotel was perfect. Got a great deal by prepaying so got a true bargain rate for a very nice room. Hotel is sleekly modern and the room is very efficiently designed. Bathroom was good with all the usual amenities plus some unexpected ones such as a toothbrush, toothpaste and a razor! Very nice touch. Also it was the only hotel we stayed at in all of Germany that had a coffeemaker in the room! Only thing it lacked was an iron and ironing board, strange since everything else seemed to have been thought of. Staff was nice and accommodating. Dining room was pleasant and attractively furnished in ultra modern style. We only had a light snack there, but it was good. Please note parking was 11 Euros for 24 hours in garage--safe and convenient. Area was nothing special, but our main objective was to be close to the airport. Less than 10 minutes away. My only real complaint was the room was too warm and we couldn't cool it down enough. Tried opening the window, but too noisy that way so we just made the best of it since it was only one night.
Reviews.Author: Pesca7

Reviews.Content: Modern Hotel It was our last stop in out Southern Germany trip. It was very clean and modern. The staff was very helpful. Though it was an airport hotel, it took us 10 euro to the city by taxi. It wasnt that bad. They also provide shuttle to the airport.
Reviews.Author: $savemoney$

Reviews.Content: First Class Business Hotel A first class hotel excellent for business travel. It is typical of the high standards you associate with German Hotels. As a business woman travelling alone, I felt safe and comfortable in the hotel, in particular going down for dinner in the evening. The bedroom facilities are first class, with top quality accessories available in the superbly fitted bathroom. It is a must for the business traveller to Frankfurt.
